channel.title: Humble Indie Bundle 2
channel.description:
[url]https://www.humblebundle.com/[/url]
It's back in time for the Holiday Season. Just like the last bundle, pay any price you want for 5 excellent indie games. You can even split the money you spend between charities and the developers.
The games are: Braid Machinarium Osmos Cortex Command Revenge of the Titan
The games are (according to the site), 100% DRM free and will run on Mac, Linux, and Windows. The pack also comes with a 2 soundtracks and one mini-album for: Machinarium Osmos Revenge of the Titans
[url='https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=orzQ2J-oDpc&hd=1']Video[/url]
I purchased the last bundle and can vouch, this is a quality purchase. All the games worked great in the last bundle, and they recently by request got Valve to give Steam copies to everyone who purchased the first bundle. I can only assume this second bundle will be the same quality.

item.title: Humble Indie Bundle 2
item.dc:creator: Maxx_Skywalker
item.description:
Samapico:

Edit: Has anyone played that Lugaru HD game? Is it just me or… it sucks badly?
I just managed to kick some bunny’s ass… then I get told to ‘look for more’, and if I run too far from the “village” (just some idle bunnies, some trees, and some ugly rocks, really), I get lost and it’s impossible to find the way back.

Let me quote myself:

Maxx Skywalker:

Lugaru is a bit meh for me. I tried it, and wasn’t too impressed. I suppose I’ll go through it someday, but I’m going through Penumbra currently.

Yeah, it’s quite lame. It’s broken up too much unnecessarily.

Read full topic

item.title: Humble Indie Bundle 2
item.dc:creator: FireTime
item.description:
Level of text wasn’t necessary for the full understanding of meanings but they did reinforce them. The story was a good show of the mental fallout of the opener of Pandora’s box. Was fun playing thru it again knowing this and how the opening concepts mesh. Like watching a movie after again and picking up more and more things.

As for drawing conclusions may I recommend the The Old Man and the Sea - Jesus relation.

Read full topic

item.title: Humble Indie Bundle 2
item.dc:creator: Jethrosoup
item.description:
Patonki:

yea its like woah the princess is SPOILERS the atomic bomb people cant be bombs thats silly, thank you disjointed level of text
but then it was deep

I’ve always wanted to write a book of complete shit and see what kind of “meanings” people glean from it.

Read full topic

item.title: Humble Indie Bundle 2
item.dc:creator: Katana
item.description:
Samapico:

Hmmmm , I played Aquaria for like 15 minutes and I wasn’t really tempted to play more… It starts slow indeed, but what is it like later on in the game?

Similar to a Legend of Zelda game, you get a number of different powers, n the form of songs that each transform you into a different form.
The first one, and often the most useful, is Energy Form, allowing you to shoot up the place with homing energy shots.
The second is beast form, which lets you swim through more powerful currents (using new powers to bypass certain barriers is a common thing in the game) and turns your ‘dash’ into a biting attack. If you eat something, you regenerate health.

You eventually work your way up to a superpowered form a bit like the Soul Cube; once you get a few kills with its normal attack, you can use its special move to destroy everything onscreen. Of course, this all happens just before the final boss.

There’s also a recipe-making system in the game. Once you pick up one of a resulting item (ie, strawberry pie) you learn the recipe (strawberry + pie). Stocking those up becomes very helpful with a number of the bosses, especially since many of them give effects like additional defense, speed, etc.

If you didn’t get to Energy Form, at least try that much and finish that dungeon. It pains me the game takes a while to get to its good parts, because I kind of wish other people would finish it.

Read full topic

Honestly, I haven’t read a book that was half as deep as this game in a long time.

yea its like woah the princess is SPOILERS the atomic bomb people cant be bombs thats silly, thank you disjointed level of text

item.title: Humble Indie Bundle 2
item.dc:creator: Samapico
item.description:
Katana:

For the record, my favorite game in the bundle (Braid included, as amazing as it is) is Aquaria. Massive adventure with plenty of optional areas, starts a little slow.

Aquaria and Machinarium had great soundtracks, often very fitting. Aquaria’s is often slow to fit with exploration and beauty, but can also tone up to a fast-paced action track for the boss fights. There was even one boss where I particularly noted his attacks were slow-paced, but very strong, and the music for that fight actually seemed to be paced just the same way.

Hmmmm , I played Aquaria for like 15 minutes and I wasn’t really tempted to play more… It starts slow indeed, but what is it like later on in the game?

Read full topic

item.title: Humble Indie Bundle 2
item.dc:creator: FireTime
item.description:
Not sure how many of you played braid to 100%, with all 8 stars + secret messages in the epilogue. Many people think braid is a deep game, like with the healing time and the final level reversal but the full story goes much further. I wont spoil anything because I was blown away when I began reading into everything but If you don’t have the time to get everything I’m sure there are vids on youtube.

Honestly, I haven’t read a book that was half as deep as this game in a long time.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: CatzEyes93
item.description:
my 6 yr old played machinarium for 4 hours and wanted more.
he then played braid and was crying within 10 minutes

Either way, I need to cut back on his puter time.

Read full topic

item.title: Humble Indie Bundle 2
item.dc:creator: Samapico
item.description:
CatzEyes93:

I am stuck already on Braid and it has already caused my 6 yr old to cry. stupid game.

I got stuck once or twice in it… a quick youtube search fixed it.

I was stuck at the bottom of the first pit… you know, when you have to hit a key that doesn’t even show up in the control config…

Machinarium disappointed me a little bit… I heard a lot of good about it. But I’ll admit I had no idea even what genre of game it was. It’s not bad, but I find it… too slow. The time spent:reward ratio is pretty low
I preferred the ‘oh yay I solved that puzzle’ feeling from playing Braid than when playing Machinarium.

Edit: Has anyone played that Lugaru HD game? Is it just me or… it sucks badly?
I just managed to kick some bunny’s ass… then I get told to ‘look for more’, and if I run too far from the “village” (just some idle bunnies, some trees, and some ugly rocks, really), I get lost and it’s impossible to find the way back.

Read full topic
